member.name: T:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PlatformParameters
member.summary: Additional parameters used in acquiring user's authorization

member.name: P:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PlatformParameters.OwnerWindow
member.summary: Gets the owner of the browser dialog which pops up for receiving user credentials. It can be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PlatformParameters.PromptBehavior
member.summary: Gets prompt behavior. If , asks service to show user the authentication page which gives them chance to authenticate as a different user.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior
member.summary: Indicates whether AcquireToken should automatically prompt only if necessary or whether it should prompt regardless of whether there is a cached token.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.Auto
member.summary: Acquire token will prompt the user for credentials only when necessary. If a token that meets the requirements is already cached then the user will not be prompted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.Always
member.summary: The user will be prompted for credentials even if there is a token that meets the requirements already in the cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.Never
member.summary: The user will not be prompted for credentials. If prompting is necessary then the AcquireToken request will fail.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.PromptBehavior.RefreshSession
member.summary: Re-authorizes (through displaying webview) the resource usage, making sure that the resulting access token contains updated claims. If user logon cookies are available, the user will not be asked for credentials again and the logon dialog will dismiss automatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.SilentWebUI.NavigationWaitMiliSecs
member.summary: This is how long we allow between completed navigations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.SilentWebUI.NavigationOverallTimeout
member.summary: This is how long all redirect navigations are allowed to run for before a graceful termination of the entire browser based authentication process is attempted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.SilentWebUI.WaitForCompletionOrTimeout(System.Threading.Thread)
member.summary: Waits on the UI Thread to complete normally for NavigationOverallTimeout. After it attempts shutdown the UI thread graceful followed by aborting the thread if a graceful shutdown is not successful.
member.returns: Returns true if the UI thread completed on its own before the timeout. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.SilentWebUI.OnAuthenticate
member.summary: Callers expect the call to show the authentication dialog to be synchronous. This is easy in the interactive case as ShowDialog is a synchronous call. However, ShowDialog will always show the dialog. It can not be hidden. So it can not be used in the silent case. Instead we need to do the equivalent of creating our own modal dialog. We start a new thread, launch an invisible window on that thread. The original calling thread blocks until the secondary UI thread completes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.WindowsFormsWebAuthenticationDialogBase.WebBrowser
member.summary: Gets Web Browser control used by the dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.SilentWindowsFormsAuthenticationDialog.SuppressBrowserSubDialogs
member.summary: Make sure that the browser control does not surface any of it's own dialogs. For instance bad certificate or javascript error dialogs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.SilentWindowsFormsAuthenticationDialog.SignalDone(System.Exception)
member.summary: This method must only be called from the UI thread. Since this is the callers opportunity to call dispose on this object. Calling Dispose must be done on the same thread on which this object was constructed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler
member.summary: Provides a scheduler that uses STA threads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler._tasks
member.summary: Stores the queued tasks to be executed by our pool of STA threads.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler._threads
member.summary: The STA threads used by the scheduler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StaTaskScheduler class with the specified concurrency level.
member.param: The number of threads that should be created and used by this scheduler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler.QueueTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Queues a Task to be executed by this scheduler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler.GetScheduledTasks
member.summary: Provides a list of the scheduled tasks for the debugger to consume.
member.returns: An enumerable of all tasks currently scheduled.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler.TryExecuteTaskInline(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether a Task may be inlined.
member.param: Whether the task was previously queued.
member.returns: true if the task was successfully inlined; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up the scheduler by indicating that no more tasks will be queued. This method blocks until all threads successfully shutdown.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.StaTaskScheduler.MaximumConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: Gets the maximum concurrency level supported by this scheduler.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.WindowsFormsWebAuthenticationDialog
member.summary: The browser dialog used for user authentication

member.name: M:Microsoft.Experimental.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.Internal.WindowsFormsWebAuthenticationDialog.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Default constructor
